intro: Cirsium oleraceum, commonly known as the common thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pinkish flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its flowers are visited by a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The plant has been used historically in herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
